benchmark_details.name: HaluEval
benchmark_details.overview: A large-scale collection of generated and human-annotated hallucinated samples for evaluating the performance of LLMs in recognizing hallucinations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To understand what types of content and to which extent LLMs tend to hallucinate.
tasks: Evaluate LLMs' capability to recognize hallucinations
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited by the capacity of ChatGPT in generating hallucinated samples.

data.source: Generated using ChatGPT and annotated by human labelers.
data.size: 35,000 samples (5,000 general queries and 30,000 task-specific examples)

methodology.interpretation: Performance evaluation based on the ability to recognize hallucinations
methodology.baseline_results: ChatGPT achieved 62.59% accuracy in question answering.
methodology.validation: Human labelers established reliability through max-voting methodology.

harm: Potential for misuse of hallucinated samples

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All user data anonymized during annotation.
